timeseries package¶

Submodules¶

timeseries.ArrayTimeSeries module¶

class timeseries.ArrayTimeSeries.ArrayTimeSeries(times, values)¶

Bases: timeseries.timeSeriesABC.SizedContainerTimeSeriesInterface

Class which stores a ordered set of numerical data using numpy arrays. Inherits from SizedContainerTimeSeriesInterface.

_times: sequence that represents time data _values: sequence that represents value data

PRE: times must be a monotonically increasing sequence

interpolate(times_to_interpolate)¶

Produces new ArrayTimeSeries with linearly interpolated values using piecewise-linear functions with stationary boundary conditions.

self: ArrayTimeSeries instance times_to_interpolate: sorted sequence of times to be interpolated

ArrayTimeSeries instance with interpolated values

>>> ats = ArrayTimeSeries(times=[0,1,2],values=[40,20,30])
>>> ats.interpolate([0.5,1.5,3])
ArrayTimeSeries(Length: 3, Times: array([ 0.5,  1.5,  3. ]), Values: array([ 30.,  25.,  30.]))
mean(chunk=None)¶
std(chunk=None)¶
times()¶

Returns a numpy array of ArrayTimeSeries times, i.e. self._times

values()¶

Returns a numpy array of ArrayTimeSeries values, i.e. self._values

timeseries.SMTimeSeries module¶

class timeseries.SMTimeSeries.SMTimeSeries(times=None, values=None, id=None, SM=None, get_from_SM=False, nosave=False)¶

Bases: timeseries.timeSeriesABC.SizedContainerTimeSeriesInterface

SMTimeSeries is an implementation of the SizedContainerTimeSeriesInterface. It uses a FileStorageManager to store the timeseries.

A SMTimeSeries instance can be made in one of three ways: 1. giving times and values, optionally with an id and a storage manager:

SMTimeSeries(times,values,id=id,SM=SM)
  1. from an existing storage manager:

    SMTimeSeries.from_db(SM,id)

  2. from a timeseries implementing the SizedContainerTimeSeriesInterface:

    SMTimeSeries.from_ts(ts,id=id,SM=SM)

SM¶

Return the storage manager used by the SMTimeSeries instance.

classmethod from_db(SM, id)¶

return a SMTimeSeries instance with timeseries from a storage manager at the given id,

classmethod from_ops(ts, SM=None)¶

return a SMTimeSeries instance from operations among SMTimeSeries instances; do not save it.

classmethod from_ts(ts, SM=None, id=None)¶

return a SMTimeSeries instance from a given timeseries that implements the SizedContainerTimeSeriesInterface.

id¶

Return the id of the SMTimeSeries instance within its storage manager.

interpolate(times_to_interpolate)¶

Produces new TimeSeries with linearly interpolated values using piecewise-linear functions with stationary boundary conditions

self: TimeSeries instance times_to_interpolate: sorted sequence of times to be interpolated

TimeSeries instance with interpolated times and values

mean(chunk=None)¶

Return the mean of the values.

std(chunk=None)¶

Return the standard deviation of the values.

times()¶

Returns a numpy array of the TimeSeries times

values()¶

Returns a numpy array of the TimeSeries values

timeseries.SimulatedTimeSeries module¶

exception timeseries.SimulatedTimeSeries.InputError(message)¶

Bases: Exception

Exception raised for errors in the input.

Attributes:
message – explanation of the error
class timeseries.SimulatedTimeSeries.SimulatedTimeSeries(gen)¶

Bases: timeseries.timeSeriesABC.StreamTimeSeriesInterface

Class for timeseries objects that have streaming input data arriving via an iterator.

iteritems()¶

Generator function returning (time,value) tuples

itertimes()¶

Generator function returning the times only

itervalues()¶

Generator function returning the values only

mean(chunk=20)¶

Return the mean of the next chunk values of the generator. Returns a float. Does not include previous values.

online_mean()¶

Return a SimulatedTimeSeries of the running mean. Note that this is computed only over the samples that are called from this method.

online_std()¶

Return a SimulatedTimeSeries of the running std. Note that this is computed only over the samples that are called from this method.

produce(chunk=1)¶

Return (time,value) as an ArrayTimeSeries object with number of items equal to ‘chunk’

std(chunk=20)¶

Return the standard deviation of the next chunk values of the generator. Returns a float. Does not include previous values.

timeseries.StorageManager module¶

class timeseries.StorageManager.FileStorageManager(directory='./FSM_filestorage')¶

Bases: timeseries.StorageManager.StorageManagerInterface

Implementation of the StorageManagerInterface that stores the timeseries on disk as numpy’s .npy format.

get(id: int) → timeseries.timeSeriesABC.SizedContainerTimeSeriesInterface¶

Retrieve a stored timeseries at the provided unique id. Return a representation of the timeseries as an object that adheres to the SizedContainerTimeSeriesInterface.

id¶

ID of the most recently stored or accessed record

reload_index()¶
size(id: int) → int¶

Retrieve the size of a stored timeseries at the provided unique id.

store(id: int, t: timeseries.timeSeriesABC.SizedContainerTimeSeriesInterface, overwrite=False) → timeseries.timeSeriesABC.SizedContainerTimeSeriesInterface¶

Store a given timeseries, with unique id provided. The timeseries uses the SizedContainerTimeSeriesInterface. Return the given timeseries as an object that adheres to the SizedContainerTimeSeriesInterface.

timeseries.Timeseries module¶

class timeseries.Timeseries.TimeSeries(values, times=None)¶

Bases: timeseries.timeSeriesABC.SizedContainerTimeSeriesInterface

Class which stores a ordered set of numerical data using lists. Inherits from SizedContainerTimeSeriesInterface.

_times: sequence that represents time data _values: sequence that represents value data

PRE: times must be a monotonically increasing sequence

interpolate(times_to_interpolate)¶

Produces new TimeSeries with linearly interpolated values using piecewise-linear functions with stationary boundary conditions

self: TimeSeries instance times_to_interpolate: sorted sequence of times to be interpolated

TimeSeries instance with interpolated times

>>> ts = TimeSeries(times=[0,1,2],values=[40,20,30])
>>> ts.interpolate([0.5,1.5,3])
TimeSeries(Length: 3, Times: [0.5, 1.5, 3], Values: [30.0, 25.0, 30])
mean(chunk=None)¶
std(chunk=None)¶
times()¶

Returns a numpy array of the TimeSeries times

values()¶

Returns a numpy array of the TimeSeries values

timeseries.binarysearch module¶

timeseries.binarysearch.binary_search(da_array, needle)¶

An algorithm that operates in O(lg(n)) to search for an element in an array sorted in ascending order.

da_array
: list
a list of “comparable” items sorted in non-descending order
needle: an item to find in the array; it may or may not
be in the array
index: int
an integer representing the index of needle if found, and -1 otherwise
PRE: da_array is a list that is sorted in non-decreasing order (thus items in
da_array must be comparable: implement < and ==)
POST:
  • da_array is not changed by this function (immutable)
  • returns index`=-1 if `needle is not in da_array
  • returns an int index ` in [0:len(da_array)] if `index is in da_array
INVARIANTS:
  • If needle in da_array, needle in da_array[min_index:max_index] is a loop invariant in the while loop below.
>>> binary_search([1,2,3,4,5], 2) #if needle in the array, return its index
(1, 'FOUND')
>>> binary_search([1,2,3,4,5], 1.5) #if needle not in array, return surrounding indices
(0, 1)

timeseries.lazy module¶

class timeseries.lazy.LazyOperation(function, *args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: object

Isolate the function call from the function execution. out = LazyOperation(function,*args,**kwargs) defines the operation. out.eval() evaluates the operation. out.eval() = function(*args,**kwargs).

eval()¶
timeseries.lazy.lazy(function)¶

Make a function return a LazyOperation instance

timeseries.lazy.lazy_add(*args, **kwargs)¶
timeseries.lazy.lazy_mul(*args, **kwargs)¶

timeseries.timeSeriesABC module¶

class timeseries.timeSeriesABC.SizedContainerTimeSeriesInterface¶

Bases: timeseries.timeSeriesABC.TimeSeriesInterface

Interface for sized-container based TimeSeries. Inherits from TimeSeriesInterface. Times for TimeSeries stored in _times Values for TimeSeries stored in _values

interpolate()¶

Require notion of value interpolation for times not present originally for sized-container based TimeSeries.

items()¶

Returns a list of (time, value) pairs

iteritems()¶
itertimes()¶
itervalues()¶
times()¶

Require ability to return stored values for sized-container based TimeSeries.

values()¶

Require ability to return stored values for sized-container based TimeSeries.

class timeseries.timeSeriesABC.StreamTimeSeriesInterface¶

Bases: timeseries.timeSeriesABC.TimeSeriesInterface

Abstract Base Class for timeseries data that arrive streaming.

online_mean()¶

Return a SimulatedTimeSeries of the running mean.

online_std()¶

Return a SimulatedTimeSeries of the running standard deviation.

produce(chunk=1) → list¶

Output a list of (time,value) tuples of length chunk

class timeseries.timeSeriesABC.TimeSeriesInterface¶

Bases: abc.ABC

Interface for TimeSeries class which inherits from ABC

identity(*args, **kwargs)¶
iteritems()¶

Iterate over (time, value) pairs.

itertimes()¶

Iterate over times.

itervalues()¶

Iterate over values.

lazy¶

Lazy identity property. self.lazy returns a LazyOperation instance of self.identity(), so that self.lazy.eval() is self.

self.identity() : a LazyOperation instance

mean(chunk=None)¶

Require ability to calculate the mean of values within a TimeSeriesInterface instance. Optional chunk argument to be used for subclass instances with no storage.

std(chunk=None)¶

Require ability to calculate the standard deviation of values within a TimeSeriesInterface instance. Optional chunk argument to be used for subclass instances with no storage.
